alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 8:44AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE AT FRIANT DAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHERN NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno and Madera. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 844 AM PDT, an upstream floodgate release is expected to cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Mendota, Biola, Friant and Millerton Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
